main.name: Lluís Garcia
main.jobDescription: help students not to bang their head on the table while trying to learn to code
main.bio: I was born in Sallent, a small town near Barcelona, and that's why I love the countryside. I play football since I was a little kid, it surely taught me sportsmanship, cooperation and the importance of teamplay. I've been travelling the world while working, and my goal is to take my job with me wherever I want.
main.contactmessage: Here is where you should write your message to readers to have them get in contact with you.

education.description: 800h Full-time, immersive 'learn by doing' course focusing on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, JSON and Java with Spring and SpringBoot, simulating real-life projects. Also used Vue, Bootstrap, JQuery, Spring, Git & GitHub, Firebase.

work.title: Lead Mentor · Freelance
work.description: Manage the mentors' team and the different course modalities (Full Time Online, Part Time Online and On Site). Content creation and product improvement, shaping the Program Plan, organization of skills by project, adapting the timelines of each project and guiding new developers along the path of code. Mentoring a Full Stack course: HTML, CSS, Javascript and MERN.

work.title: Front-End Dev (REACT) and Web Layout · Freelance
work.description: Web layout with CSS and Material UI components. Review, correct and create front-end functionalities with REACT framework.

work.title: Full-Stack mentor
work.description:
Full-time web development mentor, helping over 200 students train their web development abilities and eventually finding a job.
I started teaching the 5 month long front-end & JAVA course; I helped create the new 3 month long MERN course and teach it afterwards.
Working with HTML, CSS, JS, Vue, JAVA, MERN stack.

skills.name: Git
skills.description: I use Git for all my projects, and save them on GitHub. I have used Git for version control in a small team, but I use it the most for personal projects.

skills.name: React JS
skills.description: React is my most used framework, as I was teaching it at the bootcamps. I find it even more intersting with the addition of hooks.

skills.name: Java
skills.description: Java was the first programming language I learned in order to create an online game. Used with Spring and Spring Boot.

skills.name: Frontend Triforce
skills.description: I consider these three a must if you are into web development. These are the basics anyone should know before jumping into any framework.

skills.name: Boostrap
skills.description: Bootstrap is the framework I use the most when I want to style the webpage. Depending on the frontend framwork I use others like Material UI or Vuetify.

skills.name: Vue JS
skills.description: I learned Vue out of curiosity, and I ended up adding it to the bootcamp program. I used Vuetify for the style and Vuex as the SST.

skills.name: Node JS
skills.description: Node + Express are my go-to server side languages. Used almost every time I want to create the backend part of a project.

skills.name: Mongo DB
skills.description: Mongo is the databese I used the most for how well it works with React and Node, creating the famous MERN stack.

projects.title: Canadian Wanderlust
projects.category: My Travel Blog for my post-university travels

projects.title: Fury Fighting Gear
projects.category: (offline now) A fighting gear company I started

projects.title: Original Thai Food
projects.category: Website I built for a restaurant I like in Thailand

projects.title: Resume Website
projects.category: A React based resume website template

projects.title: Smirkspace
projects.category: (MVP Only) A React and Meteor based chat University project.

testimonials.text:
En Lluis contrasta su profesionalidad con su juventud. Siempre tiene todo controlado en su cabeza y siempre está siete pasos por delante tuyo. Con un código limpio y funcional, se adapta a cualquier adversidad que surja en cualquier proyecto.

Tiene constantemente un ojo puesto en las nuevas tecnologías y no se conforma con que algo funcione si se sabe que se puede mejorar.

Un privilegio como compañero y un placer como amigo.
testimonials.user: Raúl Matínez - CEO @ Let It Byte
